Questions.QuestionString: 1. A demand regulator in a portable oxygen bottle opens. (Level 1)
2. The cylinder of a portable oxygen set is made of. (Level 1)
3. Portable oxygen cylinders are normally charged to. (Level 1)
4. Rate of flow of oxygen is given in. (Level 1)
5. Oxygen cylinders are removed for overhaul and tested. (Level 1)
6. Oxygen bottle capacity varies between. (Level 1)
7. Oxygen filters are made of. (Level 1)
8. Anoxia is due to. (Level 2)
Answers: B. low air pressure on the body.
C. release of nitrogen bubbles in the blood.

Questions.QuestionString: 9. The dilutor demand regulator functions. (Level 2)
Answers: B. only when the supply valve is opened by the user.
C. when the user breathes in.

Questions.QuestionString: 10. To measure moisture in an oxygen system use. (Level 2)
Answers: C. a hygrometer using the dew point method.

Questions.QuestionString: 11. Oxygen cylinder test dates. (Level 2)
Answers: A. are painted in white on the cylinder.
B. are variable depending on discharge.
C. may be stencilled on the neck of the cylinder.

Questions.QuestionString: 12. Which connector has a left hand thread?. (Level 1)
13. If an O2 system is leaking, where would you most likely find the cause?. (Level 2)
14. Oxygen cylinders are normally fitted with. (Level 2)
15. Portable oxygen bottles are fitted with. (Level 2)
16. American made crew oxygen cylinders are. (Level 2)
Answers: A. black in colour with a RH thread.
B. green in colour with a LH thread.
C. green in colour with a RH thread.

Questions.QuestionString: 17. Oxygen storage cylinders, once charged should be. (Level 2)
Answers: C. turned on and safety wire-locked.

Questions.QuestionString: 18. Where are the left handed threads found in an oxygen system?. (Level 2)
19. Portable O2 diluter demand valve works when. (Level 2)
Answers: C. less than 500 psi is in bottle.

Questions.QuestionString: 20. A double headed oxygen pressure regulator is used for. (Level 2)
Answers: C. extra supply in case of emergency.

Questions.QuestionString: 21. A discharged chemical generator is indicated by. (Level 2)
22. The oxygen line service valve must be. (Level 2)
Answers: C. only be wire locked with telltale wire.

Questions.QuestionString: 23. What pressure are oxygen cylinders usually pressurised to?. (Level 1)
24. Pressure breathing systems must be used at altitudes. (Level 2)
25. Oxygen bottle test and working pressures can be found. (Level 2)
Answers: A. stamped on a metal label.
C. stamped on the neck ring.

Questions.QuestionString: 26. After installation, the oxygen bottle on/off valve is. (Level 2)
Answers: B. left in the 'off' position until required.

Questions.QuestionString: 27. The direction of flow in an oxygen non return valve is indicated. (Level 2)

28. 02 system pressure has leaked away after charging. What is the most probable cause?.
(Level 3)
29. As the cabin altitude reaches 3042 metres. (Level 3)
Answers:
A. the 02 masks deploy automatically and the crew activates the system from the emergency
panel.
B. the 02 masks deploy automatically and hang half way extended.
C. the 02 masks deploy automatically and the crew must activate the system from the cockpit.

Questions.QuestionString: 30. What is the principle of an O2 generator?. (Level 3)
Answers: A. Sodium chlorate and iron mixed by an electronic detonator.
B. Sodium chlorate and iron using a mechanical detonator producing O2 when mixed with air.
C. Sodium chloride and iron mixed by an electronic detonator.

Questions.QuestionString: 31. When charging an oxygen bottle with gaseous oxygen, the oxygen is. (Level 3)
Answers: A. passed into the bottle slowly to keep the temperature at approximately ambient.
B. passed into the bottle at any rate as this does not affect temperature.
C. passed into the bottle as quickly as possible to keep the temperature down.

Questions.QuestionString: 32. If an aircraft suddenly drops pressure at 14, 000 ft. (Level 3)
Answers: A. passenger must get mask from overhead stowage.

Questions.QuestionString:
33. If oxygen is not being supplied in normal flight conditions, the cabin altitude must be.
(Level 3)
Answers: A. at a maximum of 12,000 ft.

Questions.QuestionString: 34. A thermal compensator is used in. (Level 1)
35. In a diluter demand oxygen system. (Level 3)
Answers: A. oxygen is supplied with a continuous pressure flow.
B. each member of the crew has a continuous oxygen supply.
C. each member of the crew has a regulator.

Questions.QuestionString: 36. In a continuous flow oxygen system, oxygen is supplied. (Level 3)
Answers: A. only when the supply has been regulated by the pilot.
B. on passenger inhaling into the mask.
C. when the mask is plugged into the socket.

Questions.QuestionString:
37. In the diluter demand oxygen system, selection of emergency on this regulator will
result in. (Level 3)
Answers: B. 100% oxygen continuous flow at positive pressure.
C. 100% oxygen supply as the user inhales.

Questions.QuestionString: 38. Dangerous pressure rise in oxygen cylinders. (Level 3)
Answers: A. is relieved by a bursting disc.
B. is relieved by a thermostat.
C. is relieved by under pressurising the bottle.

Questions.QuestionString: 39. To avoid condensation forming in an oxygen cylinder. (Level 3)
Answers: A. cylinder pressure is left at 300/400 p.s.i.
B. cylinder pressure is left at 100/200 p.s.i.
C. cylinder pressure is left at 200/300 p.s.i.

Questions.QuestionString: 40. What determines the material used for oxygen pipe lines?. (Level 3)
Answers: A. The whims of the aircraft designer.
B. The length of the pipe runs.
C. The pressure used in the system.

Questions.QuestionString: 41. If a binding thread needs attention on an oxygen system. (Level 3)
Answers: A. Teflon tape may be used.
B. distilled water may be used sparingly.
C. no lubricant may be used whatsoever.

Questions.QuestionString: 42. When charging an oxygen bottle with gaseous oxygen, the oxygen is. (Level 3)
Answers: A. passed into the bottle as quickly as possible to keep the temperature down.
B. passed into the bottle slowly to keep temperature at approximately ambient.
C. passed into the bottle at any rate as this does not affect temperature.

Questions.QuestionString:
43. In areas closely associated with oxygen systems, particular care must be taken to avoid
leaving. (Level 3)
Answers: A. traces of oils or greases.

46. A chemical oxygen generator has a supply duration of at least. (Level 1)
47. Oxygen equipment must be carried by aircraft capable of flying above. (Level 1)
48. The critical altitude for oxygen requirement is approximately. (Level 1)
49. Which is the international standard atmosphere at sea level?
50. When the A/C is cruising, how much pressure is the cabin pressure maintain?
51. Normally, Oxygen is advantaged, but one thing is disadvantages. What is it?
Answers: C. Easily go up in flames

Questions.QuestionString: 52. What kind of container for crew oxygen system?
53. What kind of container for Pax. oxygen system?
54. How is the crew oxygen bottle pressure checked?
Answers: A. Direct in press gage only
C. Direct in press gage or in Ecam (Door/oxy page)

Questions.QuestionString: 55. Which is the max value of the crew oxygen pressure?
56. Which pressure value does the green Disk burst (discharge)?
57. On Airbus Aircraft, how does the oxygen system supply to cockpit?
Answers: B. Push the crew supply switch
C. Pull the lanyard in masks
